SEARCH
Package FLBConvertor

Class FLBConverter

java.lang.Object
FLBConvertor.FLBConverter
class FLBConverter extends Object
This is the tools main class - so has the main methods etc

    FLBConverter.HashMapArray
    We've defined this structure to simplify asnd ensure consistency.
    (package private) static class 
    FLBConverter.IncludesPlugin
    We need the rewepresentation of services to differ from inputs, outputs and filters.
    (package private) static class 
    FLBConverter.Plugin
    This class helps us process the plugins and directives.
    (package private) static enum 
    FLBConverter.PluginType
    Define the different plugin types.
    (package private) static class 
    FLBConverter.ServicePlugin
    We need the representation of services to differ from inputs, outputs and filters.
    (package private) static class 
    FLBConverter.SpecialPlugin
    We have extended the plugin to bring together those versions of Plugin that are more specialized such as needing singelton characteristics.

  • Method Details

    • debug

      static void debug(String msg)
      Writes a debug message if debug is allowed. If the report file is setup then we'll also add the debug message to that as well
      Parameters:
      msg - the message to write as a dubg statment

    • info

      static void info(String msg)
      Writes a log message. If the report file is setup then we'll also add the debug message to that as well
      Parameters:
      msg - message to be logged

    • err

      static void err(String msg)
      If an error needs to be logged use this method. If the file is enabled then we add the log to the file as well.
      Parameters:
      msg - message to be displayed

    • storePlugin

      private static void storePlugin(FLBConverter.Plugin currentPlugin)
      Depending upon the the label in the classic file, we need to decide which group of plugins to add the latest definition to.
      Parameters:
      currentPlugin - the active plugin we've been adding attributes to and now needs attaching to the cirrec

    • consumeClassicFile

      private static void consumeClassicFile(BufferedReader classicFile) throws IOException
      This method reads the classic configuration file and handles when we need to start a new plugin object, and when to add a plugin into the correct array of plugins. Note we only allow one service definition
      Parameters:
      classicFile - the reader object for the classiv file
      Throws:
      IOException - if we fail to read the file properly

    • writePlugins

      private static void writePlugins(ArrayList<FLBConverter.Plugin> plugins, BufferedWriter outFile, String label) throws IOException
      Takes the list odf plugins, and writes the correct prefix label before iterrating through the plugins adding them in the correct YAML format
      Parameters:
      plugins - the list of plugin objects of a particular type
      outFile - the output file buffer
      label - the label for this type of plugin
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown if there id

    • writePipelineOutput

      private static void writePipelineOutput(BufferedWriter outFile) throws IOException
      This orchestrates the corret order in which the pipeline is constructed in the YAML file.
      Parameters:
      outFile - the buffer write for the output
      Throws:
      IOException - any io errors should lead to us bailing

    • getOutFile

      private static String getOutFile(String inFileName)
      This works out the name for the output file based on the input name
      Parameters:
      inFileName - input (classic) filename
      Returns:
      output file's name.

    • processor

      private static void processor(String inFileName, String outFileName)
      We don't pass the filename of the report file as this is handled by the logging methods. This method drives the core logic of scanning the Classic file format and once read runs the process of writing each plugin/directive to the output file
      Parameters:
      inFileName - name of the classic file to be processed
      outFileName - name of the file we're going to write YAML to

    • getDateStr

      static String getDateStr()
      Generates the current date and time as a string
      Returns:
      the date time in a formatted string

    • checkDebug

      private static boolean checkDebug()
      Checks for the environment variable that control whether we log to debug level. We've not adopted a logging framework so that we can keep the code as a single class. This means we can run without needing to have a Mave or Gradle
      Returns:
      returns the boolean indicating if debug is enabled

    • checkReportToFile

      private static boolean checkReportToFile()
      If the environment variable is set then any info logs are also written to a file that is the same as the output with the filename extended with .report Useful if we're using a conversion.list
      Returns:
      true if we find the flag for producing the report

    • getPathPrefix

      private static String getPathPrefix()
      Gets the path prefix env var if set. Then if it is not terminated with slash we add a slash.
      Returns:
      the prefix path

    • useIdiomatricForm

      private static boolean useIdiomatricForm()
      Checks for the idomatic form configuration and sets the flag
      Returns:
      flag indicating whether to use idiomatic form

    • cleanStr

      private static String cleanStr(String in)
      Cleans up a string by trimming if not null. If the result of trim is 0 length string - return as null
      Parameters:
      in - the string to clean
      Returns:
      cleaned string or null

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The app's name drives the execution of processing one or more classic format files getting the inputfile from one of several different sources. It establishes the data structures that we use to manage the holding of the different plugins. Each new file is processed we reset the constructs to ensure there isn't any accidental cross contamination
      Parameters:
      args - the command line args

    • printHelp

      static void printHelp()
      Generates the CLI help
